docs.lead_paragraph: "Children of Men" is so purely cinematic, and its plot departs so widely from the book’s, that the screen version may obscure how wonderfully rich and unlikely that novel is.

docs.lead_paragraph: The one bright spot in Claribel Campusano's life spends most of his time crawling on the floor, unleashing a cascade of giggles, or running into walls. Sometimes, when he is not glued to PBS, he likes to dance. ''Te gusta la ga-so-li-na,'' Ms. Campusano sings to her son, gently pushing him into an imaginary spotlight. ''Dance, Fernando, baila!''

docs.lead_paragraph: Who knows which parent was the first to be labeled a sanctimommy. Was it the one who boasted about refusing an epidural even in her 57th hour of pelvis-splitting labor? Or maybe the one who advised not buying Cheerios because, gosh, have you ever checked the sodium content?.

docs.lead_paragraph: STRIEGEL--Jana. Dancer and published Holiday House author, passed away December 17th, 2006 at 51, after a 12 year battle with breast cancer. Diagnosed while pregnant, her successful pregnancy inspired her article for The New York Times. Jana leaves behind her husband Mark and adored son Tanner.
